results.title: Rob Roy
results.creator_credit: Talisman, Peter Broughan, Richard Jackson and Michael Caton-Jones
results.brief_description: When a harsh winter threatens the majestic Scottish Highlands, Robert Roy McGregor (Liam Neeson) is forced to borrow money from the not so noble Marquis of Montrose (John Hurt) to provide for his clan. But when Montrose’s evil henchmen (brilliantly portrayed by Tim Roth and Brian Cox) conspire to take the wealth for themselves, they thrust Rob into the most challenging battle of his life, one that escalates into a bloody and gripping climax. Breathtaking landscapes, steamy romance and non-stop action combine to make this a thrilling and powerful adventure.

results.title: Roadgames = Road games [DVD] (D)
results.creator_credit: Quest Films, Essaness Pictures and Richard Franklin
results.brief_description: A psychopathic killer is haunting the Nullarbor Highway in search of female hitch-hikers whom he picks up, rapes, kills and dismembers. An eccentric, long-haul truck driver determines to track down the murderer and is helped by a young hitch-hiker he picks up. Stars Stacy Keach and Jamie Lee Curtis.

results.title: Road to Zanzibar
results.creator_credit: Paramount Pictures, Paul Jones and Victor Schertzinger
results.brief_description: The second of the “Road” series sees Chuck (Crosby) and his pal Fearless (Hope) fleeing a South African carnival after their sideshow causes a fire. After several similar escapades, they finally save enough money to return to the States, where Chuck spends it all on a ‘lost’ diamond mine. But that’s only the beginning. Before long, a pair of attractive con-women have tricked our heroes into financing a comic safari, featuring numerous burlesque jungle adventures. Much of the film’s humour reportedly derived from on-set improvisations. Cast includes Bing Crosby, Bob Hope, Dorothy Lamour and Una Merkel. Costume design, Edith Head.

results.title: Road to Singapore
results.creator_credit: Paramount Pictures, Harlan Thompson and Victor Schertzinger
results.brief_description: Comedy venture from the team of Bob Hope and Bing Crosby, “The Road to Singapore” is a sprightly film that consistently amuses and entertains. Crosby plays Josh Mallon, the irresponsible son of a shipping magnate who would rather hang with his carefree sailor buddy Ace Lannigan (Hope) than realise his father’s lofty aspirations for him. On the eve of his wedding to long-time fiancee Gloria, Josh hightails it to Singapore with Ace in tow. Once there, the boys’ friendship falls under a cloud when they’re both attracted to saucy nightclub singer Mima (Dorothy Lamour) who goes on the lam from her possessive boyfriend Caesar (Anthony Quinn). As the boys slug it out for Mima’s affections, Gloria turns up in search of her wayward husband to be. The exoticism, spontaneity, lushness and passion of the East is contrasted with the cool, emotionless Western moneyed arena of Gloria’s world. Watch for an intriguing scene in which Crosby and Hope go ‘native’. This successful film, featuring several musical interludes, spawned six more “Road to…” movies starring Hope and Crosby.

results.title: River of no return
results.creator_credit: Twentieth Century-Fox Film Corporation, Stanley Rubin and Otto Preminger
results.brief_description: Matt Calder (Robert Mitchum), is a widower with a dubious past, attempting to restart his life with his young son Mark. Harry Weston (Rory Calhoun) is a lawless gambler with his fiancee Kay (Marilyn Monroe). Calder rescues Weston and Kay from the river only to have Weston rob him and abandon them to the mercy of warring Indians. Calder takes Kay and Mark on a dangerous journey of revenge down the raging river. The chemistry between Mitchum and Monroe and the awe-inspiring backdrop of Canada’s breathtaking secenery are the highlights of this tense western thriller.

results.title: River's edge
results.creator_credit: Hemdale Film Corporation, Sarah Pillsbury, Midge Sanford and Tim Hunter
results.brief_description: This film is a story of today’s teenagers poised perilously on the brink between adolescence and adulthood. When one of them murders his girl-friend, the others must decide for themselves which is more important - admitting knowledge of a dreadful deed, or staying loyal to a close friend. They do not know how to react and their plight is one with which everyone - young and old - can identify. It is an extraordinary document of teen life today, showing how adolescents can seem almost numbed by even the most intense, extreme situations. This film is disturbing, thought-provoking and based on a real-life incident. WARNING: SOME SCENES IN THIS FILM MAY BE DISTURBING TO SOME VIEWERS.

results.title: Risky business
results.creator_credit: The Geffen Company, Jon Avnet, Steve Tisch and Paul Brickman
results.brief_description: Joel Goodsen is an industrious, responsible and college bound teen whose parents are going on vacation and leaving him in charge of the house. No sooner do Joel’s parents leave when Joel begins to step outside of his conservative and respectable self. Transforming from a straight A high school star athlete to an uninhibited party animal, Joel invites his friends to enjoy his hospitality, as well as his parents’ liquor. Things go from bad to worse when he meets a streetwise callgirl, Lana, who lives the theories of free enterprise and high finance Joel’s been studying. Cast includes Tom Cruise, Rebecca deMornay, Curtis Armstrong, Bronson Pinchot and Raphael Sbarge.

results.title: Rio Bravo(Captioned)
results.creator_credit: Warner Bros Pictures, Armada Productions and Howard Hawks
results.brief_description: Sheriff John T. Chance arrests a gunslinger for a brutal murder. However, the outlaw’s brother is the most powerful rancher on the border and his desperadoes surround Rio Bravo so that Chance can’t get his prisoner out and the U.S. Marshall can’t get in. Hired gunmen slip silently into the little town, waiting for a chance to strike. This classic western combines the talents of John Wayne and Dean Martin with the much acclaimed skill of Howard Hawks.
